author: vors
body:
<!-- PR checklist -->
- [ ] Resolves issue #xyz.
- [ ] Code is up-to-date with `master`.
- [ ] Add tests that fail without your changes.
- [ ] Update all relevant [documentation](../docs).

<!-- Provide more details about the PR below -->

cc @hiteshraigandhi @johnkord @daxian-dbw

comments.author: daxian-dbw
comments.body:
Sergei and I talked about the new MMI package, and it looks promising to have one nuget package to cover MMI and OMI. If that works then we only need to guard the "BinaryMiLog" cmdlets with #if !LINUX.
cc @vors

comments.author: vors
comments.body: @daxian-dbw we should not have these cmdlets. They are left-overs from unfinished project and they use internal MMI APIs. I think we should remove them regardless.

comments.author: daxian-dbw
comments.body:
@vors I'm afraid removing those cmdlets would be a breaking change from the user's perspective. And also I'm concerned about the plan to FCIB binaries produced from github back to windows. If the content of binaries are diverged, then the FCIB story would not work.
Let's bring this up in the scrum tomorrow.

comments.author: daxian-dbw
comments.body:
:shipit: 
@vors As we discussed in the scrum today, let's remove those 3 files from github, and create a future issue to track this for after Aug 17.

title: Remove *BinaryMiLog cmdlets
